sen.j: 矢大臣（やだいじん）は、 神社の随身門の左右に安置されている、随身の装束をした2神像のうち、向かって左方の弓矢をもっている神像。
sen.e: Yadaijin is one of the two deity statures in Zuijin (Imperial guards during the Heian period) costumes that are placed at the both sides of Zuijin-mon gate, holding bows and arrows on the obserber's left.

sen.e: He is called Yadaijin (Minister with arrows) after his arrows, and Zuijin-mon gate is sometimes called Yadaijin-mon gate.

sen.j: 天孫降臨のとき天忍日命および天久米命が、天石靭をとり、頭椎の太刀を佩き、天波十弓をとりもち、天真児矢をたばさみ、先に立ったさまをうつしたともいう。
sen.e: Or it is said that the image of Yadaijin comes from Amenooshihi-no-mikoto and Amatsukume-no-mikoto in the lead, removing Amenoiwahagi (big rocks), holding Kabutsuchi-no-tachi (the ancient sword), 天波十弓 (bows), and 天真児矢 (arrows) at the time of Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処天波十弓、天真児矢、読み方不明です。天石靭が岩かどうかは不明です。
